This question requires knowledge about the hardness of materials and their ability to scratch glass. Glass is a relatively hard material, so only materials that are harder than glass can scratch it. Option (B) states that a crystal that regulates electronic oscillators in watches can scratch glass easily. Crystals are typically harder than glass, so this option is correct. 

Option (A) states that a rubber pencil eraser can scratch glass easily. Rubber erasers are soft and not harder than glass, so this option is incorrect. 

Option (C) states that a soft linen towel can scratch glass easily. Soft towels are not harder than glass, so this option is incorrect. 

Option (D) states that a round piece of ice can scratch glass easily. Ice is not typically harder than glass, so this option is incorrect.

This question requires knowledge about the hardness of materials and their ability to scratch glass. Glass is a relatively hard material, so to scratch it easily, you would need a material that is even harder. Option (A) is incorrect because a rubber pencil eraser is softer than glass and would not scratch it easily. Option (C) is incorrect because a soft linen towel is also softer than glass and would not scratch it easily. Option (D) is incorrect because ice is softer than glass and would not scratch it easily. Option (B) is correct because certain crystals, such as quartz, are harder than glass and can scratch it easily. Additionally, the mention of a crystal that regulates electronic oscillators in watches suggests its hardness and ability to scratch glass.

Option (B), a crystal that regulates electronic oscillators in watches, is the correct answer because it is made of a harder material than glass and can scratch it easily. Option (C), a soft linen towel, is incorrect because it is a soft material that would not scratch glass. Option (D), a round piece of ice, is incorrect because ice is not harder than glass and would not scratch it.

Option (B) is the correct answer because crystals used in electronic oscillators in watches are made from materials that are harder than glass and can therefore scratch it.
